content:
I'm experiencing a bunch of new error messages (the link cannot be resolved) one for each concept that I have in my value sets.
this is the link associated for example to the UNK concept http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/v3/NullFlavor/cs.html#v3-NullFlavor-UNK

What I should check ?
Can you click on the QA to see where in the instance the link is coming from?

Lloyd McKenzie said:

Can you click on the QA to see where in the instance the link is coming from?

I've no error in the QA for a specific value set , but for the same value set i see in the "build errors" one error for each concept (e.g. "ValueSet-professione-patient-it.html#/html/body/div/div/div/div/div/div/table/tr/td/a at Line 188, column 1880" - error - The link 'http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/CodeSystem-istat-professioni.html#istat-professioni-1.461' for "1.1" cannot be resolved)..
but maybe this is not what you were asking :-)
Each error should have a hyperlink. When you click on that hyperlink, where do you end up in your IG - is it generated content or content you maintain directly?
in the page where the value set and the associated concept is rendered (in the example above the "1.1" code)
the link for that code is however http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/CodeSystem-istat-professioni.html#istat-professioni-1.461
It looks like IPS now has the same issue with 188 of these "broken links" showing up in the qa (with Publisher 1.0.97). These appear to be generated content. @Lloyd McKenzie @Grahame Grieve
Have you got the very latest IGPublisher?
